results.title: The Tempest in Bali
results.creator_credit: Ugo Mariotti, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In 1988 a group of students from Murdoch University under the leadership of David George and Serge Tampalini staged a production of Shakespeare’s “The Tempest” in Bali during the monsoon. The program documents the various bureaucratic problems they encountered and the assimilation of Balinese dance, music and shadow puppets into the production.

results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia

results.title: [Remix: Transport]
results.brief_description: This short film is a remix of archival footage from the ACMI Collection, focusing on public transport in Victoria. The remix contains footage of trams, trains, Flinders Street Station and city streets in Melbourne.

results.title: [Agnotes Advertisement: 4]
results.brief_description:
Victoria’s Department of Agriculture (now Agriculture Victoria) produced Agnotes, a series of reference material for the industry with the aim to disseminate expert advise for best agricultural practices.

This advertisement was designed to increase the uptake of the Agnotes by farmers. It is one of many commercials produced for the Department of Agriculture.

results.title: Journey into tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways and Fortune Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.
results.description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.

results.title: Roots of happiness
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Puerto Rico. Dept. of Health and Sun Dial Films
results.brief_description: Docudram about two families in Puerto Rico, one a happy one in which the father and mother love each other and their children, the other one in which there are too many children, no understanding between the parents, and neglected and unhappy children, are contrasted to show the importance of well-adjusted, tolerant, loving parents in the development of happy productive children. Strong comparison made between children and trees, both of which should be planted far enough apart and in a number that can be properly cared for, thus raising questions of birth control.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Puerto Rico. Dept. of Health and Sun Dial Films

Strong comparison made between children and trees, both of which should be planted far enough apart and in a number that can be properly cared for, thus raising questions of birth control.

results.title: Loop
results.brief_description: A documentary about Melbourne’s Underground Rail Loop, its effect on the entire metropolitan railway system, and on the future of public transport in Melbourne. Shows the route the loop tracks and tunnels will follow around the city, the sites for the three new underground stations to supplement the present two stations, how passengers will travel from suburban stations when the loop is operating, how the loop is being constructed, and the benefits for train travellers of having five city stations close to shops, theatres and offices. Photographed by Volk Mol, sound by Don Boardman, edited by Geoff Wright, narrated by Michael Pate. Produced for the Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority.

results.title: The Magic Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films
results.description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.

results.title: The Unfinished Dance
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Aspirational young ballet dancer refuses to let anything or anyone get in her way to becoming a prima ballerina. Cast includes Margaret O’Brien, Cyd Charisse, Karin Booth, Esther Dale, Thurston hall, harry hayden, Danny Thomas.
